name: Edward Terry
text: This place is worth a visit. They serve large portions for fair prices. Consistently well organized and with great atmosphere. Would recommend to others.

name: Lydia Viola
text: Excellent food, kind staff, constantly excellent atmosphere. They charge convenient rates and the food quality is great. Great work.

name: Bad baby Tionna

text: Driver looked as if he just rolled out of bed. Needs to retire his shirt. Food was good on the buffet i was there 45 mins only seen them put out one pizza. Not cool.

text: When they answer the phone, they're pretty good. the problem is that they have had issues with their system and have been offline on and off for the last two weeks and it seem's to be on going. ‚Ä¶More

text: Syllacauga Pizza Hut is a joke... We go in right after 3 other people. They order, we order, we all get our drinks, their food comes out, and we're still waiting a while before ours comes out. Even our appetizer didn't come out until about ‚Ä¶More

text: It's just not that good. Buffet had 4 pizzas. Salad bar food was aged. Seems to be very little commitment from owners to invest in quality.

name: Sonja Ethridge

text: This store took my money and I didn't get my pizza. The lady on the phone was rude. I had to call the corporate office to my money back. I will never order from this store again. She claim she didn't know how to refund my card.

text: The Sylacauga place is EXCELLENT, don't go to the Childersburg one. Don't know what's happened to them but their awful. Someone from their Corporate office needs to come and straighten this place out or just close the doors all together.

name: Luke Krause
text: Dined in and the pizza was OK, although not much better than Little Caesar's. Salad bar was very limited and way too high priced for what it was. I could have eaten at a fine dinning location for the same price for a family of 4. If other huts are like this one it's only a matter of time till all pizza huts are gone.
